concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_liens.general_basket] Universal catch-all basket (9/9). Always near the end of the permitted liens list. Phrased as 'other Liens' in all 9 deals (64% precision). Usually capped as 'greater of $X and Y% of Consolidated EBITDA' (7/9). Caps range from $5M (Arch, Sleep Number) to $750M (Caesars). Pass 2: removed 'aggregate' (noisy, <10% precision).
search_strategy.fallback_escalation: Search for 'Permitted Liens' or 'Permitted Encumbrances' in Section 1.01 defined terms. If inline, search for 'other Liens' or 'materialmen' near negative covenant headings. 'Permitted Liens' (5/9) and 'Permitted Encumbrances' (2/9) have complementary coverage — need both.
xref_follow: Section 1.01 for 'Permitted Liens' definition (Arch, National Vision) or 'Permitted Encumbrances' definition (LendingTree, Viavi) — baskets may be split between covenant section and defined term
Cross-references to specific Indebtedness section baskets (e.g., 'Liens securing Section 10.01(j) Indebtedness')
Intercreditor Agreement references for lien priority mechanics

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_liens.ratio_liens] Ratio-tested lien basket — present in 4/9 deals. Two patterns: (1) Inline ratio test (Caesars: 'Total Secured Leverage Ratio'; Viavi: 'First Lien Leverage Ratio'/'Secured Leverage Ratio'), (2) Cross-reference to defined term (Boyd: 'Ratio Debt', LendingTree: 'Permitted Ratio Debt'). Pass 2: removed 'Senior Secured Leverage Ratio' (0/9 — dead).

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_liens.intercreditor_priority] Present in 5/9 deals (Boyd, Caesars, National Vision, Red Rock, Viavi). Liens securing first/second priority debt subject to an intercreditor agreement. Pass 2: removed 'senior to' (0/9 — dead).

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_liens.non_loan_party] Present in 5/9 deals. Pass 2: removed 'Non-Loan Party' (0/9 — dead; deals use 'Non-Credit Party' or 'non-Guarantor' instead).

concept_specific_keywords: not constituting an Event of Default
concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_liens.statutory_liens] Universal basket (9/9). Statutory/trade liens arising in ordinary course of business. 'materialmen' (9/9, 100% precision) is the single best Liens-section indicator across the entire strategy. Sleep Number uses 'warehousers' instead of 'warehousemen'. Boyd and Red Rock include 'maritime liens'.

[neg_cov_liens.tax_liens] Universal basket (9/9). Always the first or second basket. Permits liens for taxes/assessments not yet due or being contested in good faith. Very standard language across all deals.

[neg_cov_liens.workers_comp_bonds] Universal basket (9/9). Workers comp/social security/unemployment insurance deposits + performance bonds/surety bonds for bids, tenders, contracts, leases. 'unemployment insurance' (8/9, 100% precision) is the best anchor.

[neg_cov_liens.real_property] Universal basket (9/9). Real property encumbrances that don't materially interfere with business operations. Pass 2: removed singular 'right-of-way' (0/9 — deals use plural 'rights-of-way' exclusively).

[neg_cov_liens.judgment_liens] Universal basket (9/9). Judgment liens that do not constitute an Event of Default under the cross-default provisions. Usually references the EoD section (e.g., Section 11.01(h)).

[neg_cov_liens.ip_licenses_subleases] Present in 8/9 deals (all except Sleep Number). Two sub-types: (1) Liens from granting licenses/subleases to others in ordinary course, (2) Liens from IP/software/technology licenses granted to the borrower group. Viavi includes 'covenants not to sue'.
search_strategy.fallback_escalation: Search for 'Permitted Liens' or 'Permitted Encumbrances' in Section 1.01 defined terms. If inline, search for 'other Liens' or 'materialmen' near negative covenant headings. 'Permitted Liens' (5/9) and 'Permitted Encumbrances' (2/9) have complementary coverage — need both.
xref_follow: Section 1.01 for 'Permitted Liens' definition (Arch, National Vision) or 'Permitted Encumbrances' definition (LendingTree, Viavi) — baskets may be split between covenant section and defined term
Cross-references to specific Indebtedness section baskets (e.g., 'Liens securing Section 10.01(j) Indebtedness')
Intercreditor Agreement references for lien priority mechanics

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_liens.purchase_money_lease] Universal basket (9/9). Liens securing purchase money obligations and capital/finance lease obligations. Pass 2: removed 'Capitalized Lease' (redundant with 'Capital Lease'). Added 'equipment being financed', 'equipment financed', 'property or equipment' (fixes National Vision miss — cross-refs S10.1(d) with equipment financing language).
search_strategy.fallback_escalation: Search for 'Permitted Liens' or 'Permitted Encumbrances' in Section 1.01 defined terms. concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_liens.banker_setoff] Universal basket (9/9). Statutory/common law banker's liens, rights of setoff, and netting agreements on deposit/securities accounts. Deals vary between 'set-off' and 'setoff' spelling.

[neg_cov_liens.loan_document_liens] Universal basket (9/9). Liens created under the loan/credit documents themselves (the foundational security interest). Pass 2: removed 'Loan Documents' (plural), 'Credit Documents', 'Administrative Agent', 'Collateral Agent' (all noisy — appear in many baskets within the section). Added singular 'Loan Document' (fixes Quidel miss). Retained 'Security Documents' and 'Cash Collateralization' as distinctive anchors.

[neg_cov_liens.existing_liens] Universal basket (9/9). Grandfather clause for liens existing at closing, usually identified by a schedule reference. Pass 2: removed 'Schedule', 'Closing Date', 'Effective Date', 'set forth on' (all <10% precision — appear throughout document, not distinctive to this basket). Added 'existing as of' and 'listed on' as higher-precision alternatives.

[neg_cov_liens.conditional_sale_consignment] Present in 8/9 deals (all except Sleep Number). Liens from conditional sale, title retention, and consignment arrangements + precautionary UCC filings. Pass 2: removed 'UCC' (noisy — appears in many unrelated contexts). 'consignment' (7/9, 100% precision) and 'precautionary' (6/9, 75% precision) remain excellent anchors.
[neg_cov_liens.intercompany_liens] Present in 6/9 deals. Pass 2: removed 'in favor of any Guarantor' (0/9 — dead), 'between Loan Parties' (0/9 — dead).

[neg_cov_liens.receivables_securitization] Present in 6/9 deals (Arch, Caesars, LendingTree, National Vision, Quidel, Viavi). Liens on receivables and related assets for permitted receivables financing/securitization facilities.

[neg_cov_liens.earnest_money_deposits] Present in 7/9 deals. Pass 2: removed 'cash deposits' (0/9 — dead), 'Permitted Acquisitions' (0/9 — dead). Added 'escrow deposits', 'purchase price', 'letter of intent' (fixes Viavi miss).
[neg_cov_liens.insurance_premium] Present in 5/9 deals. Pass 2: removed 'financing of insurance' (0/9 — dead).

[neg_cov_liens.defeasance_discharge] Present in 6/9 deals (Arch, Caesars, National Vision, Quidel, Red Rock, Viavi). Liens on cash/investments deposited or escrowed for defeasance, discharge, or satisfaction of indebtedness.

[neg_cov_liens.gaming_vessel] Industry-specific, present in 3/9 deals (Boyd, Caesars, Red Rock — all gaming companies). Liens required by gaming/racing laws, gaming leases, and permitted vessel liens.

[neg_cov_liens.customs_revenue] Present in 6/9 deals (Boyd, Caesars, National Vision, Quidel, Red Rock, Viavi). Liens in favor of customs and revenue authorities arising as a matter of law to secure payment of customs duties in connection with importation of goods.
[neg_cov_liens.swap_hedging] Present in 4/9 deals (Boyd, Caesars, National Vision, Viavi). Liens securing swap/hedging obligations and cash management services.

[neg_cov_liens.joint_venture_equity] Present in 5/9 deals (Boyd, Caesars, National Vision, Red Rock, Viavi). Put/call arrangements and restrictions on disposition related to equity interests in joint ventures, often arising from organizational documents.

[neg_cov_liens.lessor_title_interest] Present in 7/9 deals (Arch, Boyd, Caesars, LendingTree, Quidel, Red Rock, Viavi). Any interest or title of a lessor, sublessor, licensor, or sublicensor under leases or licenses. Near-universal basket.

[neg_cov_liens.initial_deposits_margin] Present in 5/9 deals (Boyd, Caesars, National Vision, Quidel, Viavi). Reasonable customary initial deposits and margin deposits attaching to commodity trading or brokerage accounts.
[neg_cov_liens.sale_leaseback] Present in 3/9 deals (Caesars, Quidel, Viavi). Liens arising out of permitted sale and leaseback transactions.

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_liens.refinancing_liens] Present in 8/9 deals (all except Sleep Number). Liens securing refinancing of permitted indebtedness, limited to the same property (no 'spreading'). Pass 2: removed 'refinancing' (noisy — 'Permitted Refinancing' is much higher precision).
